title: JavaScript needs Debug IDs
description: Sentry is proposing the adoption of content-addressable Debug IDs as a new industry standard to replace fragile, URL-based source mapping with a deterministic and reliable way to link minified JavaScript to its original source code.

title: Fix your actual slow-loading assets with Resource Monitoring
description: How Sentry's Resource Monitoring feature helps identify and optimize slow-loading web assets by understanding how resources are used in production workloads.

title: Local Variables for NodeJS in Sentry
description: Introducing local variable support for Node.js SDK, enabling developers to view variable values directly in error stack traces for easier debugging.

title: The Sentry Remix SDK is Now Available
description: Announcing Sentry's new SDK for the Remix framework, enabling monitoring of both client-side and server-side aspects of Remix applications.

title: Understanding the Performance Impact of Generated JavaScript
description: How developers can reduce JavaScript bundle sizes by understanding transpilation and down-compilation processes, with optimization techniques that helped reduce the Sentry SDK by 29%.

title: JavaScript SDK "Package Size is Massive" - So we reduced it by 29%
description: How Sentry achieved a 29% reduction in their JavaScript SDK bundle size through ES6 migration, code removal, enhanced tree shaking, and magic strings.

title: JS Browser SDK: Bundle size matters
description: Sentry's efforts to reduce their JavaScript browser SDK bundle size by 20%, explaining why bundle size matters for web performance and user experience.

title: Sentry For Data: Error Monitoring with PySpark
description: Announcing Sentry's PySpark integration that brings enterprise-grade error monitoring to Apache Spark data pipelines.
